[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Credential Exposure] Can an attacker extract the gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path through deserialization attacks or error messages, allowing unauthorized access to GCS bucket containing critical indexer data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Path Traversal] Does gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path validate against path traversal attacks (../, symlinks), potentially allowing an attacker to read arbitrary files from the validator's filesystem? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Information Disclosure] Are service account credentials logged, serialized to disk, or transmitted in error messages, potentially exposing GCS authentication tokens to unauthorized parties? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Access Control] Can gcs_file_store_bucket_name be manipulated to point to an attacker-controlled bucket, allowing injection of malicious indexer data that could corrupt node state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Configuration Injection] Does bucket name validation prevent injection of special characters or control sequences that could cause command injection when constructing GCS API calls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Path Traversal] Can gcs_file_store_bucket_sub_dir contain path traversal sequences (../) that escape the intended bucket subdirectory, allowing access to unauthorized GCS objects? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Deserialization Attack] Can malicious serde deserialization of GcsFileStore inject null bytes or control characters into bucket_name/sub_dir fields, causing filesystem or API vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Resource Exhaustion] Can enable_compression be toggled dynamically by an attacker to cause excessive CPU usage during decompression of maliciously crafted compressed indexer files (zip bombs)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Credential Reuse] Are service account keys reused across multiple environments, allowing compromise of one indexer node to provide access to production GCS buckets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: GcsFileStore] [Memory Safety] Does cloning gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path in create() methods leave sensitive credential paths in memory longer than necessary, increasing attack surface? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Path Traversal] Can local_file_store_path contain absolute paths or symlinks pointing outside intended directories, allowing an attacker to write indexer data to arbitrary filesystem locations (e.g., /etc, /root)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Permission Bypass] Does LocalFileStore validate filesystem permissions before writing, or can it write to directories that should be read-only, potentially overwriting critical system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Race Condition] Can local_file_store_path be modified between validation and use (TOCTOU attack), allowing an attacker to redirect file operations to unintended locations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Deserialization Attack] Can PathBuf deserialization accept malicious Unicode or null-byte injection that bypasses filesystem security checks when creating files? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Resource Exhaustion] Can local_file_store_path point to a filesystem with limited space, allowing an attacker to cause disk exhaustion by triggering excessive indexer file writes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Symlink Attack] Does LocalFileStore follow symlinks, allowing an attacker to create symlinks in local_file_store_path that redirect writes to sensitive system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Compression Bomb] Can enable_compression be exploited with maliciously crafted compressed files that expand to massive sizes, causing disk exhaustion or memory overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [File Permission] Are created files/directories assigned secure permissions, or can they be world-readable/writable, exposing sensitive indexer data to local attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Path Canonicalization] Does the implementation canonicalize paths before use to prevent bypasses via /./ or multiple slashes in local_file_store_path? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Struct: LocalFileStore] [Directory Traversal] Can relative paths in local_file_store_path combined with current working directory changes cause writes to unintended locations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Function: default_enable_compression()] [Configuration Security] Is compression disabled by default for security reasons, and can enabling compression introduce decompression vulnerabilities that weren't considered during security review? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Function: default_enable_compression()] [Performance Attack] Can an attacker force compression to be enabled through configuration injection, causing validator performance degradation due to CPU-intensive compression operations? (Low)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Enum: IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig] [Configuration Injection] Can malicious JSON/YAML inject additional enum variants or modify the tagged union structure to bypass validation checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Enum: IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig] [Type Safety] Does serde deserialization properly validate enum discriminants, or can out-of-bounds discriminant values cause undefined behavior or memory corruption? (Medium)
